title: Maps and Geography Basics

vocab.definition: A drawing that shows what places look like from above
A symbol on a map that shows the directions north, south, east, and west
A very large area of land on Earth
A very large body of salt water

teachingNotes: Use classroom maps and globes. Practice using cardinal directions. Connect to students' own neighborhoods and school location.

sample.question: What tool on a map helps you find directions?
Name one of the four main directions.
What is a continent?
expectedAny: a very large area of land

sample.question: What is an ocean?
expectedAny: a large body of salt water

truefalse.question: The ocean is smaller than a lake.
A compass rose shows north, south, east, and west.
A map shows places from a side view.
A globe is a round model of Earth.
East and west are the same direction.

multiplechoice.question: If you are facing north and turn right, which direction are you now facing?
What does a map key tell you?
Which is NOT a cardinal direction?

fillintheblank.question: The four main directions are north, south, _____, and _____.
A drawing that shows places from above is a ___.
A very large area of land is a ________.
A very large body of salt water is an ________.
A ________ shows directions on a map.
A round model of Earth is a ________.

shortanswer.question: Why do we use maps instead of just looking around us?
How can a compass help you?
Describe one difference between a map and a globe.
expectedAny: map is flat, globe is round

shortanswer.question: What symbols might you put on a map of your classroom?
How would you explain a map key to a friend?
Give directions from the front door to the office using cardinal directions.
